intro: Peucedanum aegopodioides, commonly known as the lesser cow-witch. It is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. The plant features slender, branched stems and small, fern-like leaves that are deeply divided. Its flowers are small, greenish-yellow, and clustered in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. The plant is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to temperate climates.
